page.title: 17LANDSCAPE:NEWCASTLES HOUSING
page.content: Our survey block holds two of Newcastle's most expensive housing estates. They are Seabridge and the Westlands. They both consist mainly of large detached owner-occupied houses and even some flats. As we work out toward the M6 the houses become isolated farmhouses. There are some people living in Keele University. The housing there is- hotel style, single, double and triple rooms for the students. Past the M6 are small villages like Butterton. The houses here are large, old, pretty and very expensive. To summarise all of this, the houses in our survey are mainly large, expensive and owner-occupied. Some are part of estates, some part of tiny villages and some completely isolated.
